title: Streeting vows to keep disruption to a minimum as doctor strike begins
description: Hospitals are told to cancel non-urgent work only in exceptional circumstances as a five-day resident doctors strike starts.

title: The story behind the photograph of a starving Gaza baby
description: Photographer Ahmed al-Arini told BBC Newshour he had to catch his breath between each photograph.

title: Trump to fly into Scotland for golf club visits - and a meeting with Starmer
description: His private visit is exceptional as US presidents rarely promote their personal interests so publicly while in office.

title: Samaritans to close more than 100 branches
description: The charitys chief executive says at least half of their branches will close in the UK and Ireland.

title: Kelly Osbourne lost best friend after Ozzys death
description: She has made her first comments since her fathers death at the age of 76 on Tuesday, posting lyrics from the song Changes.

title: Hot weather boosted retail sales in June
description: Supermarkets sold more drinks and fuel sales were up as people ventured out, the UK statistics body says.

title: Watch Trump jokes he wants Powell to lower interest rates in awkward exchange
description: The US president and Federal Reserve chair bickered over the cost and timeline of the Feds headquarters renovation project during a tour.

title: Blood, sweat and tears Look back at Hulk Hogans highs and lows
description: The all-American hero of wrestling also had a Hollywood career and was one of Donald Trumps biggest fans.

title: People with gluten allergies to be given cash cards to help pay for their food
description: One woman who took part in the pilot says it only scratches the surface of food bills.

title: Starmer urged by MPs to recognise Palestinian state
description: A majority of MPs on the foreign affairs committee urge ministers to make the move immediately.

title: I can barely do one story. I just feel dizzy - BBCs Gaza freelance journalists tell of struggle for food
description: Three freelance journalists working for the BBC in Gaza are facing the same dire circumstances as those they are covering.

title: One in five children in Gaza City is malnourished, UN aid agency says
description: The UN agency for Palestinians says it has thousands of truckloads of supplies near Gaza which it wants to deliver.

title: He went to get aid and didnt come back - stories of people killed in Gaza
description: As aid agencies warn of mass starvation, the BBC hears from the relatives of some of those killed in the past week.

title: Israel and US leave Gaza ceasefire talks in Qatar
description: US special envoy Steve Witkoff accuses Hamas of showing a lack of desire to reach a ceasefire in Gaza.

title: Weekly quiz Who rescued Englands Lionesses against Italy?
description: How much attention did you pay to whats being going on in the world over the past seven days?

title: The fractured friendship behind the fight at the Thailand-Cambodia border
description: The countries have a history of occasional conflict, but this latest fight comes after an old friendship crumbled.

title: The Papers Threat to NHS from strikes and UK must do more on Gaza
description: Doctors strikes and the UK response to the humanitarian situation in Gaza lead Fridays papers.

title: Ren√©e Rapp Media training is boring, I cant give fluffy answers
description: Rapp made headlines by going off script on a press tour for the Mean Girls movie. She has no regrets.

title: Artificial food colours are out, so whats next?
description: Big food firms are phasing out artificial colours, so tech firms are rushing to fill the gap.

title: Woman in viral Coldplay concert clip resigns from executive role
description: The clip showed a man and woman swaying to the music before quickly ducking and hiding from the camera.

title: Justice department official meets Epstein accomplice Maxwell
description: The meeting comes as pressure grows on the Trump administration to release files linked to the disgraced financiers sex trafficking network.

title: Pro-Palestinian convict freed by France after 41 years
description: Georges Abdallah will immediately be expelled to his native Lebanon after his release early on Friday.

title: More traders to challenge rate-rigging convictions
description: The traders decision to appeal comes after the victory of two other traders in the Supreme Court

title: Raducanu beats Osaka but Venus Williams loses in DC
description: Britains Emma Raducana is through to the quarter-finals of the Washington Open after beating Naomi Osaka in straight sets but Cameron Norrie, Dan Evans and Venus Williams lose.

title: Trade deal on US tariffs within reach, says EU, as 1 August deadline nears
description: The EU says its negotiators are working might and main on a deal, but the decision rests with US President Trump.

title: Five ice hockey players found not guilty in Canada sexual assault case
description: The verdict marks the end of the highly publicised case, in which the men were accused of sexually assaulting a woman in 2018.

title: BBC News app
description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Mass Starvation Warnings in Gaza
description: Humanitarian groups urge Israel to allow aid access

title: Donald Trump vs The Wall Street Journal
description: Trump has sued the WSJ, but theyre not backing down

title: Speed, stamina and skill - Stokes is now Englands best seamer
description: Why Ben Stokes is bowling as well as he has ever done after years of knee problems.

title: Wiegman not for sale at any price, says FA chief
description: England manager Sarina Wiegman is not for sale at any price, says the Football Association chief executive officer Mark Bullingham.

title: Isak wants to explore move away from Newcastle
description: Alexander Isak wants to explore his options for a move away from Newcastle this summer as he misses the pre-season tour of Asia.

title: No need to extend VAR powers, says FA chief
description: FA chief executive Mark Bullingham says VAR interrupts the game enough and should not have more powers.

title: Who needs teeth? Returning Whittaker laughs off gruesome injury
description: Robert Whittaker had his bottom teeth dislodged in defeat by Khamzat Chimaev in October but is set to return to action against Reinier de Ridder in Abu Dhabi on Saturday.

title: Stokes, Crawley and Duckett star as England take control of fourth Test
description: Ben Stokes stars with the ball before an excellent batting performance from Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley gives England control of the fourth Test against India, with the home side closing day two on 225-2 at Old Trafford, 133 runs behind Indias first innings score of 358.
